website_summaries.verdict: Leak-proof liner, but pad absorbs slowly, setting up a potential edge leak.
pros: Good-sized pad for puppies and small dogs
Very absorbent material with a liner that is not prone to leaking
Pad doesn’t slide around easily on floor
cons: Some owners note that if puppy doesn’t go in the center of the pad, pee may leak or roll off the pad
Some puppies like to chew these rather than pee on them

customer_reviews.title: Very Similar, but Thicker than Amazon Basic Pads
customer_reviews.text: I just ordered the All-Absorb pad, it's noticeably thicker than the Amazon Basic pad. If I didn't replace the Amazon pads regularly (like after 2-3 uses), it would start to leak onto the floor from saturation. The Amazon pads are a little less expensive (thinner, about 1" smaller in one dimension), so if you replace after every use or two go with that one. If you like the flexibility of a more absorbent pad or have a bigger puppy, this one seems better. Will try these out tomorrow. In the photo, All-Absorb on left, Amazon Basics on right.
customer_reviews.author: mb

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone way down..
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this product for several years, auto delivery. But this last order was totally different. First of all they used to be in a box, now just a bag. That would have been OK, but the quality went way down. I noticed I had to change them twice a day instead of my usual once. They would be totally soaked, I mean dripping. I found some from a previous order and the difference in thickness was very noticeable. So, Why would I pay the same and have to use twice as much. Have to start shopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Maraya

customer_reviews.title: Urine spreads - My dog doesn't like them
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Larger size at a good price gives these pads "bang for the buck" Cons: Unlike the previous brand I used for many years, these pads are thinner and do not contain the urine spots to a small enough area. As seen in the photo, the urine spreads out too far on the pad. The result is that my small dog doesn't want to step on the pads after one use and I end up using more pads than before. Plus I'm finding myself cleaning up more accidents because my dog doesn't like stepping on them. Will be going back to my previous brand as soon as they're back in stock on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: B W

customer_reviews.title: The pads have changed from March 2020
customer_reviews.text: I just received my newest shipment of pads and something changed - all 100 pads seem to be defective. Not sure if they changed the way they made them or this batch was just off but they do not absorb as there is scarce padding to absorb the urine. My last shipment in March was fine and I have ordered the pads since 2014 with no quality issues (with note, these pads do not hold a lot of urine at a time - definitely for puppies not older dogs with incontinence).
customer_reviews.author: NCGirl

customer_reviews.title: ... compared prices & 100 pads for 20$ is a great deal. I was running low and my puppy ...
customer_reviews.text: I compared prices & 100 pads for 20$ is a great deal. I was running low and my puppy doesn't get to go out while I'm at work for several hours unless my roommate is home so I use pee pads daily. And I change it daily. The quantity was worth the price. Not sure if dogs can sense the pad is meant to be peed, the box states it does. My dog was already pre trained before buying this item. The package arrives within 7 days.
customer_reviews.author: LUCLUTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Price up / Quality zero
customer_reviews.text: This used to be the best puppy pads you can buy but recently the price went up 25% as well as the quality went down to horrible. There is zero absorbency and it seems like the gel that used to be there has now turned to powder and goes everywhere, it makes a mess all over you and the carpet and everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Deana Zawacki

customer_reviews.title: Affordable quality product that pet owners should have!
customer_reviews.text: Sometimes work has me gone longer than the girls can hold their urine - so I need a reliable, affordable product. These are much better than the Amazon Basics I used to buy by locking in moisture faster - little or no tracking. I’m glad I tried these out - you should be too!
customer_reviews.author: Trey T

customer_reviews.title: These pee pee pads p'd me off!
customer_reviews.text: These pads are terrible. Every time my Bichon tinkles it soaks through. We're not talking about a big dog. She's 12 pounds. They do not have any type of odor protection. Strong urine smell. I'm piling up multiple pads at a time and have to mop after every clean up. So annoying. SAVE YOUR MONEY! I didn't even waste my time taking pics for this review because other people have already posted pictures. I figured with me having a little dog I'd still give it a shot. Oh well. On to the next brand.
customer_reviews.author: Swipeaholic

customer_reviews.title: Check & double check the reviews
customer_reviews.text: I don't know who the writers are giving this product 3 & 4 stars but unless you enjoy constantly cleaning your floor because of the pee overflow, I would not buy this product. The padding on these pads are so thin that it hardly holds anything. Unfortunately I relied on the reviews that I read before buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: tinkerbell

customer_reviews.title: A non-slip underside would be a serious improvement
customer_reviews.text: The price is good, but our biggest complaint is, they slip and move waaaaay out of position to easy with puppy traffic, then are useless. Why can't they manufacture these with a mild silicone non-slip strip or spots on the underside, so as to help them stay in place? - C'mon, it's the 21st century. Surely someone out there can come up with something here. Am I right??
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda Porter

customer_reviews.title: No longer what they used to be
customer_reviews.text: I have small dogs that don't like going out in the winter. For years I have ordered these pads and been pleased. But in the past 6-8 months the plastic lining got thinner and thinner and now the absorbent part is also very thin. They are useless. I used to need maybe two pads a day during the day and now it's six to eight AND the floor still gets wet b/c the plastic is no longer absorbent. UGH. If I could give negative stars I would.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for cats too
customer_reviews.text: I have a cat who won't use the litter box to pee in, but will (most of the time) pee on a pad. I grew quickly tired of using newspaper and the cost for these is reasonable and they are easy to dispose of and don't stink, unlike wet soggy newspaper. Another thing I like about these is the large size. My cat often targets his flow more to the edge of the tray, these pads are large enough that I can fold up the pad against the sides of the tray I place it in and all his pee is captured and absorbed. For me that was the trick to making these pads work and not leak.
customer_reviews.author: LN

customer_reviews.title: Very absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: I've tried three different brands of pads and this is my favorite. I made a square box for the pad so it doesn't slip or move. I live in an apartment so my chihuahua uses these pads everyday. She is a small dog so I cannot speak how the pads would work for larger dogs. I don't have a problem at all. They are absorbent pads and do not smell. Of course, I flush feces right away and after a few urine uses I throw it away. Out of the 3 brands that I tried, I'm sticking to this one.
customer_reviews.author: RG

customer_reviews.title: They get the job done
customer_reviews.text: My puppy refuses to do her business outside because it's too cold for her most days, so I turned to these pads (same brand my son uses). They work great--completely leak proof and not too expensive. At the moment I've had to turn to washable pads since the little monster has ripped these up the last couple of times I put them down in her play pen. My son tells me that his 4 month old puppy liked to tear them up, too, but has now settled down and uses them appropriately (except for the occasional running around the house with one in her mouth).
customer_reviews.author: R. Moore

customer_reviews.title: What I needed
customer_reviews.text: I loved how it’s a lot for this good price It had before sad that I try reordering it cuz I was running out had few left now the price went to high no thanks the first time I guess got lucky so had to find something else to order for the pee pads. It was way cheaper before it was 16.99 now like 40 something nope
customer_reviews.author: Jacqueline A Pintor

customer_reviews.title: Great puppy pads. Ferrets use them.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for my ferret cage. They work great. They are very absorbent. My little ferrets love their puppy pads. It gives them the freedom to run around the house. When they see that puppy pad they run over to it to potty. I didn't even train them for this. These are strong and they hold the liquid. This is helpful when cleaning up. Nothing is worse than cleaning up after leaky puppy pads! This size is good. perfect for protecting a corner in the house.
customer_reviews.author: Elayna

customer_reviews.title: They are super absorbent and don't leak through
customer_reviews.text: They are thinner than the pads we were buying at Sam's but don't let that fool you. They are super absorbent and don't leak through. Because they are thinner, they are also easier to throw away. The ones we used before took up half the trash can. Our dogs do seem attracted by the scent and have had less accidents. We also have an elderly cat that uses them and she's had no accidents either. Just wish they had tape on the back for her. Would highly recommend. We're on our second package.
customer_reviews.author: RGB

customer_reviews.title: Great puppy pads
customer_reviews.text: I've tried dozens of puppy pads and for a long time I tried avoid the ones with the blue backing because none seemed to absorb well. I tried another similar brand with the blue backing that proved that theory wrong. But they were about $10-15 more expensive than this All-Absorb brand. So I decided to give this brand a shot to save money and hopefully not skimp on quality. I'm almost done with my box of 100 and they are very absorbent. I also recently got a pad holder to prevent my pup from going off the pad and onto the floor. So far the combo of these pads and the holder work well together!
customer_reviews.author: AmberHale

customer_reviews.title: Misleading
customer_reviews.text: These pads are no longer made in the US, even though the pictures on their Amazon profile say they are. They've also changed in quality. I've bought them before and they were always really absorbent, but now they leak through. I don't recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Rusty Swanson

customer_reviews.title: I've used this brand before but, in the larger size.
customer_reviews.text: I found that 'size does matter' in the case of these pads. I've been using 4-6 pads @ a time by overlapping them to stem the overflow of urine but to no avail. I was surprised that the smaller pads didn't seem to absorb as well. It appeared the pads just didn't retain the moisture to prevent run off, they didn't jell like they're supposed too. I'm ordering the larger pads again & hopefully I won't be disappointed. Thanks! CAE
customer_reviews.author: C. A. Edmunds, RN

customer_reviews.title: Dog Uses Them But They Leak
customer_reviews.text: I have used these for several years because my 12lb. morkie does use them. But they leak since they changed over from China to USA manufactured. Don't believe me put one on the floor with a paper towel under it and poor some water on it and see what seeps through to the paper towel. I am changing brands.
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: They're okay
customer_reviews.text: In terms of absorbency/not leaking, these things are great. I have a pupper with some mild neurologic issues that has made potty training a stuggle, so we still have to keep pads down, especially at night. These pads don't leak/make a mess like our previous ones, but they do NOT hold in the odor at all. And it's not just over the long term, it's immediately. I can smell it seconds after she uses the pad, and especially at night, it's not great being woken up by the scent.
customer_reviews.author: Cass

customer_reviews.title: Reasonable for the price
customer_reviews.text: These pads are appropriate for the price although the price has gone up a bit. The last shipment, each pad was mistakenly folded back on two ends which meant I had to shake them really hard to get them to open completely before I could put them down. It was very aggravating as it was more trouble than it sounds.... other than that I would recommend them but they are fair as opposed to a really good value.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: Ok, not great
customer_reviews.text: The size is good. I use 2, side by side. (23 by 24). I change often so leakage is controlled, unless my dog pees near the edge, (quite often, than it goes off the edge. When my dog goes the stain is small, he’s 9 pounds, but in a few seconds it spreads to a very large spot. Because of the spreading, urine often ends up on the floor. I’ve tried the Insta Rise Borders, and they did not help. All-Absorb, try harder!
customer_reviews.author: Lois Graber

customer_reviews.title: A godsend for a cat peeing outside his box
customer_reviews.text: My cat was just diagnosed with diabetes and is drinking huge amounts of water and peeing huge amounts. He actually goes into his litter box, but stands with his tail towards the opening so he pees outside the box. This product is amazing! I tuck one end of the pad under the litter box to keep it from moving, and it is large enough to contain all the fluid with absolutely no odor. I can't recommend this product highly enough!
customer_reviews.author: 4catmama

customer_reviews.title: Used to be great now just ok
customer_reviews.text: We’ve been buying these for a couple of years now. However this last batch varies in size and the pad themselves (white part) are smaller than before. Will likely not repurchase and change brands to find a more absorbing pad.
customer_reviews.author: Betsy Cook

customer_reviews.title: Great value and work well
customer_reviews.text: These are great! We put them down for our 2 year old, potty-trained pup-- whenever we go out for a few hours. Just so she can go if she really needs to, before we get back home! She has kidney issues (crystals in her urine, which we've been treating with special dog food), but because of that, it seems she can't hold her pee while we're out, so she'll continue to use these pads even though she's fully grown and potty trained. She has no issue with going on the puppy pads AND in the grass when we go on walks. 100 pads for $20, is SUCH a great value :)
customer_reviews.author: K.M.

customer_reviews.title: Changed materials
customer_reviews.text: Not the same as the last order. The materials have definitely changed. Won’t buy them again.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: Great value and great puppy pads
customer_reviews.text: We had a litter of 12 puppies. We had gone through several different kinds of puppy pads. These held up the best. We tape them together and lay them down. These are also the best value that we had seen around. I would order them again if I needed them. I highly recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Melody  S

customer_reviews.title: Keep looking
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because they changed the quality of the Amazon brand without telling me. These aren't a whole lot better. They're folded smaller and they're all bunched up when I lay them down. The only way they straighten out is if they're peed on. They are good for pulling the moisture away from the top but not before my puppy walks through and tracks them on my floor. I guess my hunt for pads, like the Amazon ones used to be, continues.
customer_reviews.author: Hot mess

customer_reviews.title: Absorption
customer_reviews.text: These pads are thick and quilted. I will always order if they continue with the quality! I tried Hartz and my female Maltese lifted her legs to avoid stepping in her pee as hearts is so thin. Hartz advertises gel filled. If there is gel, it is around outer square! These are less expensive and high quality. Have been a small dog owner for over 20 years! I know good pee pads!
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: Great... half the time
customer_reviews.text: These are really great... half the time. I guess they are made by at least two different factories. When I open the box to see the pads are packaged in plastic, I know they will be very poor quality (the layers aren’t sealed together). When they are not packaged in plastic, I know they will be very high quality (my favorite of any brand we’ve tried). I never know which kind I’ll get.
customer_reviews.author: S. Scheufens

customer_reviews.title: 100% will soak through
customer_reviews.text: Horrible do not buy. I don't know how there's so many positive reviews. I bought this brand because the normal ones I get have been extremely late with shipping( haven't even been delivered weeks after ordering) so ordered these in the meantime and I have to double them up because everything soaks through even when doubled. I ended up buying a more expensive brand which works a lot better but these are extremely cheap and soak through even when doubled.
customer_reviews.author: JA. Lopez

customer_reviews.title: Great value for 100 pads
customer_reviews.text: I have always purchased potty pads for accidents and generally I have done so at Big Lots and Sams Club. These are just as good and the value is better. I love that I don't have to go find them anymore and that they arrive every month for me.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie C.

customer_reviews.title: Once was a great product, but now poor quality.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve bought this product countless times for two elderly cats I trained to use them. Something has changed in this last batch. MUCH thinner...almost see thru. What did the company do?
customer_reviews.author: P. Davis

customer_reviews.title: Best yet.
customer_reviews.text: Not perfect, we still have leaks, but definitely better than any other pads we've used. We have 2 young puppies, one is 7 months and the other is 3.5 months, so we've gone through a lot of pads already and will continue using them. I have bought almost every brand I have been able to try and these work better than any of the others. Was thinking of trying the Amazon Basics next, but not sure if we will since these are mostly doing their job and we've been so disappointed with every other type of pad so far.
customer_reviews.author: StephTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Amazon Brand is better
customer_reviews.text: Because this vendor offered "UPS" delivery, I tried this product. Amazon puppy pads are 60% better. This products leaks. However, this product is larger than Amazon brand...to this may be a benefit and why I gave it 3 stars under "for potty training." Note: My dog is a AKC Brussels Griffon 6 years old. He uses the pads as needed during the evening. However, you will need to have paper towels and/or towels/containment container on hand to clean up the access urine.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor I.

customer_reviews.title: Will buy again
customer_reviews.text: Now that I have tried another brand, I will definitely come back to buying these again. We are using them for an older dog (small - 8 lbs) who has accidents so we place the pad in a crate for when we are gone for long hours. These pads do a good job of soaking up a decent amount of liquid, but the plastic liner on the underside prevents way more moisture than another brand I've tried. Also, I don't smell as strong a urine smell with these pads as some others. Will buy these again if we continue to need them.
customer_reviews.author: angel99mm

customer_reviews.title: All-Absorb - accurate name!
customer_reviews.text: I switch between these pads and the Amazon Basics ones to hopefully throw my puppy off. She tends to try to rip her pads up when she's feeling particularly noncompliant. I feel that these pads a bit higher quality that the Basics, and are harder for her to destroy. They also feel thicker and absorb better. This isn't a big knock on Amazon Basics because I haven't had any bleed through with either pad. I'm just pointing this out for those with bigger dogs who may expel more urine than my 9-pound terror. I look forward to not having to buy these consistently, but will always keep a few on hand.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin RTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Yes!
customer_reviews.text: These hold much more urine than the ones I have purchased at the pet stores. I have my dog go to the bathroom on the balcony on these and they are so so nice to not have to change as often as the ones I get from the store.
customer_reviews.author: courtney

customer_reviews.title: Best Pee Pads when it comes to thickness and absorbness.
customer_reviews.text: Best pad for my puppies. I have two 9mo maltese puppies and have tried several different brands of pads. Co-workers and friends provided with their leftovers from their training days so I had a bountiful amount of pads to explore. I must say the All-Absorb really absorbs well in comparison to other brands. Even compared to the one's that are advertised with having like 20 frikin layers or something. Price-wise is pretty comparable to brands that are up there so I always make sure to reorder these when I'm slowly running low.
customer_reviews.author: Steve-O

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY THIS POS
customer_reviews.text: TERRIBLE absorption.. DO NOT buy unless you want your dog soaked in his pee.. Pee was FLOATING on top of the pad. Positive reviews Amazon posted were 4 years old. See if this review gets posted. Think not
customer_reviews.author: Dogguy

customer_reviews.title: Good price for a great product
customer_reviews.text: These were such a good price, I was hesitant. My dog weighs only 10 pounds, but she pees a river when she goes. It absorbed it all, controlled the smell, and didn't leak. I pick them up shortly after she uses it, when possible, and I don't notice a smell. I had purchased a different brand with a lavender scent, but prefer these. I will buy these again!
customer_reviews.author: Cindy S

customer_reviews.title: Good pads for a great price
customer_reviews.text: My dog likes all pads at first. Then she starts missing as time goes on. I bought these pads because a friend gave me some and my dog likes these the best. Thankfully, she always pees on them. It's the other deposits that miss the mark occasionally. So I bought these and a few other brands and trade off every few days. That seems to do the trick. I've never had any problems with urine leaking through this brand and there is no smell whatsoever after she takes care of her business. I definitely recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Batya67

customer_reviews.title: Great variability
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying these for years. The ones I received recently barely have any padding, you can see through the bare spots. The prior order was nicely quilted and thick. I will give them one more chance, after that its on to something else
customer_reviews.author: Carole G

customer_reviews.title: Quality has gone down, not as good as they once were.
customer_reviews.text: I think I will have to try another potty pad product! These would have received 5 stars except that they are not the same. They feel flimsier, there is less quilting to hold them together and my little chi rips them up easily with scratching. I hope I can find something else....boo....
customer_reviews.author: K. Vill

customer_reviews.title: Significantly worse quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been “subscribe & save” this product for more than half a year now, it has been good enough for my 10lbs dog till the last delivery in July. When you touch it, you can simply tell that the pads are significantly thinner than the past; after my dog used on the pad ONCE, the pee was leaked to the floor. So I have to double it up now. I don’t know if one-off defect product was sent to me or they reduce the quality of their pads in general from now. I have to say I am disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon S.

customer_reviews.title: Poor Absorption and Leaks Through Pad
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a 100 pack when the product was on sale at a super discounted price. Now I know why... The pads are extremely thin and leak through. These pads are used with the cat litter boxes that have the grates along with dissolving pine pellets. Have to double up and still pee leaks through to both pads. So gross. The frequency of having to change out the pads is 2-3 times more than the Member's Mark brand which is much thicker and way more absorbent plus better at trapping odor. There's better out there. Would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LoveLola

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for what I need!
customer_reviews.text: Best there is for me. The size works and my small dog uses these when she can’t make it outside. Very absorbing and helps reduce the scent. They are also great for traveling!
customer_reviews.author: HeatherH

customer_reviews.title: These Work Great!
customer_reviews.text: We have a blind stray kitty in our laundry room that doesn’t seem to want to use the litter box. We have these down on the ground to stop her potty and poops from ruining the concrete floor. They are smaller in size than the more expensive pads, but they seem to work just as good. Very happy with the price and quality!
customer_reviews.author: Jeff B.

customer_reviews.title: Worst puppy pads by far.
customer_reviews.text: Worst puppy pads ever. My dogs have never chewed up their puppy pads. These leak and are worthless. I wish I would have requested a refund sooner. My dogs shred right though these in a second within putting them out. Idk if it's something they are made out of or what but I will not but these again. On top of that I spend too much time picking up all the shredded materials all over the floor. Buyers be ware. Do NOT BUY. WASTE OF MONEY and time. The one time they used them they just leaked right through. I have chosen other brands before and had no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Courtney Fenske

customer_reviews.title: very poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been buying this product for years and the quality was always great However, after they changed the package, the past two shipment were very bad quality, especially the last one Leaking, breaking, glue in between the folding so the pads were ripping just being unfolded Very poor manufacturing Don't buy
customer_reviews.author: fulvia barbadoro

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing Change in Quality
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this brand of potty pads for my Shih Tzu for 3 years now. I have been very satisfied, until this latest shipment arrived. Every pad in my package has an unsealed corner edge, and the absorbent stuffing comes out. Quality control must be slacking. I’ll give them the benefit of the doubt and assume it’s just a single bad batch, but if my next shipment has the same issues, I’ll be looking for a new brand to buy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.text: A complete waste of money unless you like mopping your floor twice a day! I have a 9 week old Bolognese that weighs 2 lbs 8 ozs & I change his pee pad after he uses it 3 times. He goes such a small amount but every time I remove the used pad to replace it the floor is wet. This product is no better than layers of newspaper!!!
customer_reviews.author: Patty

customer_reviews.title: Good Value
customer_reviews.text: Seems like a really good value. Unfortunately we had to order multiple boxes of pee pads during our potty training phase but we always ended up buying these again. Some of the cheaper brands can be really thin and not very absorbent but these worked the best for the price. They definitely aren't moisture proof for long periods of time. Sometimes the carpet would be damp under the pad if we let it sit for several hours before picking it up like on long work days.
customer_reviews.author: Nathan

customer_reviews.title: Highly absorbent!
customer_reviews.text: We've tried Amazon recommended pads with 150 count and found them to be lacking in the absorbency department. These pads are far superior providing enough absorbency to allow for double use before having to replace them. Also, unlike previous pads, these don't tend to leak onto our hardwood floors. Previous pads, although cheaper, have damaged our hardwood floors. :(
customer_reviews.author: Professor B

customer_reviews.title: What a shocker. These work.
customer_reviews.text: I'm surprised at how well these absorb urine. My dog weighs 90 lbs so that says a lot. I purchased them because the Wee Wee brand was out of stock. I actually need the extra large size but this brand was out of that size too. So I made a patchwork layout of 4 of them. These appear thin and they feel very soft compared to the other brand, but somehow they absorb all the liquid. Also I've noticed that the urine does not wick back up under the pad from the edges and onto the floor underneath as much as every other brand I've tried. Im switching to these when the extra large size gets back in stock.
customer_reviews.author: bezoarrn

customer_reviews.title: These work good, just need to ensure you have a pee pad base
customer_reviews.text: We have a dog who is indoor trained with these as when she was a puppy our street was being replaced and she was scared to death of the equipment (long haired chihuahua) so using pee pads is all she knows. I have been getting these pads for ~2 years and they work great IF you have a pee pad base to catch the runoff. These just are not absorbent enough and if she doesn't go dead center it will roll onto the floor. Thats the only reason im giving it a 4 star.
customer_reviews.author: Jack

customer_reviews.title: Good pads, absorbent and no leaks
customer_reviews.text: These are good pads, more absorbent, and leak proof. My problem is the border is very light colored, and my kitchen floor is white, so my senior dog doesn’t see them well. They work well upstairs on a wood floor, but I’ll have to get a darker bordered style for the kitchen. I had been using Pads from CVS, but they’ve gone downhill lately.
customer_reviews.author: Stacey1995

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality and Economical
customer_reviews.text: Our pup is about 8 months old now and he uses these pads pretty faithfully. I use them with a pad holder which saves a lot of headaches! One change of pads daily amounts to just a few dollars a month, and is well worth it! The urine odor can become overpowering if the pad is not changed daily. I buy the 100 ea. packs and will soon order my 3rd pack. I have never had a a leak or a problem with this product.
customer_reviews.author: Gila Trader

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PADS VERSATILE FOR MANY HOUSEHOLD USES.
customer_reviews.text: Very absorbent & great size. Price is reasonable compared to other training pads. Our small rescue dogs uses only occasinally at night.We use under her food & wayer bowls to absorb spills. Also use under som plant pots on our porch. They also make great ckeaning pads for all of our floors.
customer_reviews.author: CHLOE RUSSELL

customer_reviews.title: An Excellent Solution
customer_reviews.text: For my use they're not training pads, but they have provided an exceptional answer to a difficult problem. I have a cat who stopped using the litter box. These pads have been an excellent solution for this. Amazingly, the cat has been faithfully using the pads. And, even more amazing, the pads have protected the carpet with no exceptions. And, they are also a buffer for any odors.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Super absorbent.. best pads ever
customer_reviews.text: I have a senior dog and we live in an upstairs apartment.. I go through a lot of piddle pads trying to find the best ones.. I hit the jackpot with these.. super absorbent.. stays on the pad and doesn’t leak through to the floor.. I just ordered 2 more boxes
customer_reviews.author: kerry bergenholtz

customer_reviews.title: Most absorbent in price range!
customer_reviews.text: After trying many brands in this price range, these are the most absorbent pads I have bought. There is a more expensive brand that tops this one, but they are too expensive for a disposable item. I really like these pads for my 2 dogs. One is a min- pin and the other one is a “big bladder” big Yorkie that weighs 24 pounds.
customer_reviews.author: Anahull

customer_reviews.title: Multi- purpose
customer_reviews.text: Bought these to help house trian our puppy. That didn't work out so well. She shredded the pee pads the moment we put them down. On a good note, since I still had approx 95 pads left to use.. they came in very handy to cover the pillow and bed of a sick child. Saved us from having to do lots of wash!
customer_reviews.author: A.K.Smith

customer_reviews.title: QUALITY CHANGE
customer_reviews.text: I've ordered these countless times and they've worked great UNTIL my last order. What a notable difference! For the WORSE! They are thinner you can even see through the padding! Don't waste your money like I did!
customer_reviews.author: E German

customer_reviews.title: Different than normal but does the job okay
customer_reviews.text: I buy these all the time but this batch seems different. They are much thinner and less absorbent than normal. My dog is potty trained indoors so I go through a lot of them. I’m not sure if they switched the quality or i got a bad batch. They are usually fantastic
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Stanton

customer_reviews.title: I use these under my litter boxes
customer_reviews.text: I actually use these as liners for underneath my litter boxes, since my one cat always seems to miss. These do a good job of catching the pee, and saving the floor. We use two at a time and change them every other time (since she doesn't always miss). The only complaint I have is that these are exact squares, and they're a little small, so it's hard to line them up when you're trying to guess-timate as to where the cat may pee next.
customer_reviews.author: Casey May

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional Value
customer_reviews.text: These actually work better than I first expected. Only thing I wish they had was a barrier type edge to keep my doggie from leaking Off the edge, which ends up running under the pad. His eyesight isn't what it used to be, so he misses the edge sometimes. They are still just as good as some more expensive ones I have tried.
customer_reviews.author: Persnickety

customer_reviews.title: Pitiful quality. What happened?
customer_reviews.text: I subscribe to these pads. The quality has dropped nd the quality has gone. They are useless. Want to quit regular orders but can not find out how.
customer_reviews.author: Kay R.  Martin

customer_reviews.title: These are amazing - absorbant and large size!
customer_reviews.text: I have a medium size dog that has Cushings Disease and diabetes. We keep her in at night and most of the time when we are at home. These are amazing - absorbant and large size! I've used Arm & Hammer and Target brand pads and those will often leak and are smaller and thinner. They leaked so badly, I was always in with a mop and bucket in the morning, wondering if straight newspaper would have been more effective! The ones from Costco aren't bad, but these are even more absorbant and I don't have to make a trip to dreaded Costco to get them. Free 2-day shipping with Prime, please don't ever discontinue that.
customer_reviews.author: J. Scantlin

customer_reviews.title: Cannot beat the price.
customer_reviews.text: They are a bargain on a monthly subscription.. I've been buying these for a couple of years to ensure my pups have their area clean and available when I'm not home, if they can't wait. Absorbency is pretty much the same as any other pee-pad we've tried so I rather stick to the these.
customer_reviews.author: G Ubinas

customer_reviews.title: thinner
customer_reviews.text: caompare with I bought in petsmart. emmmm...I only can say you get what you pay for. its thinner than 99 cents store quality. left:petsmart right:amazon
customer_reviews.author: yang ni

customer_reviews.title: Super Absorbent
customer_reviews.text: We have a hospice foster cat who is lame in the rear and stands in her box because she can't squat. Thus, she overshoots the sides unintentionally. We have a large hard plastic chair roller pad under her box and I overlap 4 of these to create a super absorbent surface. These things are amazing! No odor and super easy to change out. We have shag carpet and these things are a lifesaver. I'm on my second box and highly recommend this brand. They are so absorbent that overlapping them just a bit works incredibly well if you need a larger surface. Perfect for litter box areas as a protector and catch-all and a lifesaver for hospice kitties who overshoot.
customer_reviews.author: SweetPea66

customer_reviews.title: Great pee pee pads. Don't soak thru. Yay!
customer_reviews.text: These pads work very well. Even better than the WeeWee pads I had been using. They are so great that my kitten uses them too. Hahahaha! He uses the pads and his litter box. 🤔😂🤷‍♀️ The only complaint I have is they don't seem to all be cut the same. I was using the WeeWee pads and they were good. But these pads seem to hold more liquid. But around the edges they aren't cut the same each length and width seem to vary slightly with each pad from the same box.
customer_reviews.author: TjaneTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The price is better than Walmart's too and much better quality
customer_reviews.text: These are well made training pads. I have an older (17 yr old) cat that won't go to the litter box anymore, but she will go on the pads. These pads are solid filling throughout. Many other brands, if you hold up and look at a light, there is scattered cotton or whatever absorbent material they put in them. These have the absorbent material throughout in one solid piece. The price is better than Walmart's too and much better quality. I've used the ones from Sam's club too and they were no match for this brand. I'm on my second box and won't buy any other.
customer_reviews.author: S. Reihart

customer_reviews.title: Quality Change
customer_reviews.text: I have been using these pads since the beginning of this year, and for my small dog, they worked great. This last order, the pads are totally different. The fabric is much lower quality and density, and they have some sandy filler that leaks out when unfolding. Was a great product, but I’ll be returning my most recent order and not buying again.
customer_reviews.author: G

customer_reviews.title: Versatile pet-pads
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these a few years ago to put just outside of our cat's litter box so that if she didn't quiet make it in the box the pad absorbed everything. Pads also helped to clean her paws when she stepped out of her littler box. We have also used these pads to line our bird's cage. The pads absorb well and waste doesn't shift when pads are moved.
customer_reviews.author: Lorianne O.

customer_reviews.title: Do not waste your money. 100% leaking!
customer_reviews.text: This pad is leaking 100%. Looks like they are trying to save money for the pad. Most of pad, 2/3 pad's area doesn't fill up the pad enough. As a result, it leaks a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Great value!
customer_reviews.text: The only issue I have is when my pet peed on the side the urine would go completely under it somehow. As long as she peed on the white then we were fine.
customer_reviews.author: Summer P.

customer_reviews.title: Works great.
customer_reviews.text: My older sheltie can't always control his bladder, so I put 2 over each other in the doorway he has chosen for his accidents. One time he peed through both, but the rest of the time one has been enough. Also put one on my mother-in-law's chair to protect her cushion. (Yes, I know you can buy pads for people, but this was an emergency.) I'll buy more.
customer_reviews.author: Kenoshasunshine

customer_reviews.title: they work
customer_reviews.text: I liked the fact that my dog used them. She was attracted to the pads and we didn't have accidents on the floors or rugs. What I didn't like was she continually looked for a pad to do her business on and we found it difficult to get her trained for the outdoors. She only wanted to use the pads.
customer_reviews.author: Marilyn Caminiti

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and exellent price !
customer_reviews.text: Use this for the litter pan of our guinea pigs I was using diferent brand with lavander smell and the gel stuff but I decided to buy this brand and try it and Im glad I did they work perfect for my guinea pigs the other brand I had to use 3 on each litter pan because they leaked so bad with this brand I only put 2 because they absorb a lot better and they are bigger , exellent price I use 6 per week so I have plenty for 4 months, definitely recommend them
customer_reviews.author: Aby_stars2016

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for our 12 lb dog
customer_reviews.text: Our dog unfortunately loves peeing on soft surfaces. Our princess of a dog would prefer something comfortable to step on while peeing rather than going outside. We maintain a full supply of these pads which come in handy. She is about 12 pounds and this size works well for her. Nothing goes through the pad after she uses it. On a few occasions she will go on the side rather than the center which is frustrating however , I believe that is her issue and has nothing to do with the pad size. I am pretty sure even if it was 12 feet she'd still choose to do that once in a while.
customer_reviews.author: danielle bryant

customer_reviews.title: Versatile.
customer_reviews.text: Like these very much. Also use for other things. Like as chair pads for the car when I take my pooch.
customer_reviews.author: Neilsgrany

customer_reviews.title: jury's still out...
customer_reviews.text: My pup must be part of the minority. She goes everywhere EXCEPT the pads. I've got about 15 or so spread out over spots she's gone but she avoids the pads. Not drawn to them as advertised. I think part of my problem is my pup can't hold it-or won't & she won't do the usual "sniff for the perfect spot". She'll just squat wherever she is. I was hoping she'd have more interest in them.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: Stinky
customer_reviews.text: I'm not sure if it's my dogs or the fact that these retain the urine pretty well but doesn't give off a nice odor. I imagine having a scented pad would deter the pet (maybe). I have to change them after every pee spot or else the area stinks.
customer_reviews.author: CARRIE

customer_reviews.title: Best Pee Pad I've Found. BONUS my dogs don't eat them!
customer_reviews.text: I use two sizes of the All-Absorb Training Pads. I tried three or four different brands before I found these. My puppies (I have two) were eating and/or shredding all of the other pads. They use these pads for their pee and poop and nothing else. Yeah! I have them completely trained and they only go on the pads. I started out with pads all over my house but we are down to two locations now. I have recommended to several friends and they use them now too.
customer_reviews.author: Peony

customer_reviews.title: Attractant works great!
customer_reviews.text: These are on the cheap, thin side, but they do the job. In some of the pads, the cotton absorbency isnt spread out evenly. The attractant seems to work. My puppy consistently pees on the pads. For the price and quantity I would probably buy again.
customer_reviews.author: LC

customer_reviews.title: Works for cats, too!
customer_reviews.text: We have a Cat Genie for our 2 cats, but the older one is a lot less particular about where she pees these days, and had lots of "accidents" outside the box. I first tried adding a traditional litter box, but the smell & mess were unbearable. Now I just put these pads inside the 2nd box, and no more accidents! She took to them no problem, and the pads can hold about a day's worth of pee. (Happily she still visits the Cat Genie for #2s.) Best of all, the pads are so large I can cut them in half to fit the tray, so it's a double value for me! Will definitely be buying these again.
customer_reviews.author: Epbot

customer_reviews.title: Ok
customer_reviews.text: I bought these because it was a good deal. They aren't that thick though and pee seems to still go through a little bit. I don't know if I would buy these again. Not the best quality but worth the price. I wouldn't put them over carpet though, I wouldn't trust them to be leak proof. I only use over tile.
customer_reviews.author: jolene

customer_reviews.title: Great Pads!
customer_reviews.text: These are great training pads! I tried a few others during the first few days of training, and these are the best! They are the perfect size and VERY absorbent! Clean up is a breeze! If you are laying out more than one pad, I would recommend you tape them together - otherwise they will be moved all around by your puppy! Now my only regret is that I bought the larger quantity box, because my dog is now potty trained and I have 3/4 of the box still! Perhaps I will use them under the sheets when my young grandchildren sleep over! I would highly recommend these All-Absorb Training Pads!
customer_reviews.author: MC

customer_reviews.title: Very good and can absorb quite a bit.
customer_reviews.text: We have used these for years. They work really well. The only problem we have is that if our dog urinates close to the edge, that it can sometimes be too much for the pad to absorb before it leaks over the edge. But other than that, we have not ever had an issue of it leaking through the pad...just off the pad.
customer_reviews.author: Graycmyers

customer_reviews.title: Will continue buying
customer_reviews.text: I'm using these for my cat who can't always make it into the litter box due to hip dysplasia. They soak up the urine well and don't leak through to the floor, which makes for easy cleanup. They control the smell with one urination, but if she goes twice, it does smell. I do have a sensitive nose though. I was using paper towels before and going through way too many. This is a much better solution for me.
customer_reviews.author: E. McGee

customer_reviews.title: USA made
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to buy puppy pads that are made in the USA...but so far I've used about 6 and pee goes right through. Hopefully they will make the plastic a bit thicker so they don't leak through. The ones made in china don't leak through. :(
customer_reviews.author: Mary J Fasoli

customer_reviews.title: After he was better, he still wouldn't go in the box
customer_reviews.text: My 2 years young male cat had a urinary tract infection and stopped pissing in the litter box. I used these which worked very well. I would typically overlap them near the litter box. After he was better, he still wouldn't go in the box. Luckily, while on vacation a member of my family switched from the paper litter to clumping, and he started right back in the box. I have two cats, and one box and they seem to be fine when I clean daily.
customer_reviews.author: Yeah Totally!

customer_reviews.title: Great puppy pads
customer_reviews.text: These are large enough for my golden doodle puppy who weighs about 25 lbs. I line a crate without a top and this is her potty spot. It works out very well with these pad. They are very absorbent which is a plus because they do not leak through. Especially good because my crazy puppy whenever she can loves to pick them up and run with them in her mouth. :) So that is one of the reasons the super absorbent pad is an added plus. I received these at a discount for my honest opinion And have been buying them ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Suzanne

customer_reviews.title: Works OK
customer_reviews.text: I have a pad for each of my 2 dogs. I have to double the pads because urine soaks through, leaving the floor underneath wet. This pad will work for tiny, teacup size dogs and puppies. It's not so great for my 16 lb or 20 lb dogs. Next time, I'll buy larger pads and hope I won't have to double up.
customer_reviews.author: SC Weiss

customer_reviews.title: Have used for years, recently several leaded through to carpet!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm now 3 years into my second dog using these pads, & the x-large ones. I've used these for years. They seem to be making them thinner lately, & on several of the pads my little Yorkie's pee soaked through to the carpet!! And he didn't pee much at all. I'm so disappointed. Will try ordering them ONE more time, & if they leak through again, I'll change brands.
customer_reviews.author: R. Burns

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these for my 17 year old Chihuahua child who has begun having some issues with where to pee pee. Totally impressed with these pads... the soak up the urine and the top layer stays dry. I've used them like a rag to clean accidents from the floor. Also use under her blankets and in our bed just in case she has an accident. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: D Shaw

product_meta.title: All-Absorb A01 Training Pads 22-inch by 23-inch
product_meta.description: Size:Pack of 100Every All-absorb training pad consists of 5 layers of materials. The first layer is made of non-woven cloth, which allows dog urine flow through to the absorbent core quickly. The second layer is made of paper tissue, added with dog attractant and baking soda. The third layer is a mix of super-absorbent polymer and fluff pulp, which forms the absorbent core that can absorb and turn dog urine to gel instantly. The absorbent core can hold 3 cups of liquid. The fourth layer is also made of paper tissue. The back layer is made of water-proof PE film, which prevents wetting your floor.
feature_bullets: The super-absorbent core can turn urine into gel instantly and hold up to 3 cups of liquid
Perfect for training puppies or assisting aging dogs
The package may be different due to transition from Made in China to Made in USA

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
